intro: Macowania glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular macaw, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its glandular hairs on the leaves and stems, which give it its scientific name. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and prominent stamens. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
